Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics

Class Color

java.lang.Object
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics.Color
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Color extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an RGBA color. Provides arithmetic operations on colors and methods creating derived colors.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Color

      public Color(int r, int g, int b)
      Constructs a new color with the specified color components and an alpha value of 255 (fully opaque)
      Parameters:
      r - the color's red component, ranging between 0 and 255
      g - the color's green component, ranging between 0 and 255
      b - the color's blue component, ranging between 0 and 255

    • Color

      public Color(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Constructs a new color with the specified color and alpha components.
      Parameters:
      r - the color's red component, ranging between 0 and 255
      g - the color's green component, ranging between 0 and 255
      b - the color's blue component, ranging between 0 and 255
      a - the color's alpha component, ranging between 0 (transparent) and 255 (fully opaque)

      public static Color multiply(@NotNull @NotNull Color color, float f)

      Parameters:
      color - the color
      f - the factor
      Returns:
      the modulated color

    • withAlpha

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public Color withAlpha(int alpha)
      Creates a new color by copying this color and resetting the alpha value.
      Parameters:
      alpha - the alpha value of the new color, ranging between 0 (fully transparent) and 255 (fully opaque)
      Returns:
      a color with the same r, g and b components and the specified alpha component

    • withOpacity

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public Color withOpacity(float opacity)
      Creates a new color by copying this color and resetting the alpha value.
      Parameters:
      opacity - the color's opacity value ranging between 0.0f (fully transparent) and 1.0f (fully opaque)
      Returns:
      a color with the same r, g and b components and the alpha component of opacity * 255

    • darker

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public Color darker(float factor)
      Creates a color darker than this color. Each component c of the resulting color (except alpha, which remains the same) is decreased by factor * c.
      Parameters:
      factor - darkening factor ranging between 0.0f (color unchanged) and 1.0f (color completely black)
      Returns:
      the resulting darkened color

    • brighter

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public Color brighter(float factor)
      Returns a color brighter than this color. Each component c of the resulting color (except alpha, which remains the same) is increased by factor * (255 - c).
      Parameters:
      factor - lightening factor ranging between 0.0f (color unchanged) and 1.0f (color completely white)
      Returns:
      the resulting lightened color

    • grayscale

      @Contract(pure=true, value="-> new") public Color grayscale()
      Converts this color to a grayscale version. Each component of the resulting color (except alpha, which remains the same) is computed using the NTSC formula: (0.299 * r + 0.587 * g + 0.114 * b). This formula closely represents the average person's relative perception of the brightness of red, green, and blue light.
      Returns:
      a grayscale version of this color
